Management

Two Miles Our Team

Two Miles

Management Team

Hiro Isogawa

Owner, Chief Motivational Officer, CPA, MIM

Robert Han

Chief Operating Officer, in charge in Consulting
and Fractional CFO/vCFO Services

Masayuki Ohno

Representative from Hawaii Office,
Chief Messenger, CPA (US CPA), FP2 Grade Tech

About Hiro...

Originally from Japan, Hiro graduated from Kyoto University and worked for NEC Corporation in the Human Resources International and Overseas Marketing Division. Then after graduating from American Graduate school of International management, he worked as a tax deferral investment packager, then at KPMG in the tax department. Hiro founded Two Miles in 1998.

Hiro's Blog - Beautiful Earth, Beautiful People

What is your favorite quote?

I (Jesus) have come that they (Hiro) may have life, and have it to the full. (John 10:10)

Why are you working at Two Miles?

I started it, so I better!

What do you like to do outside of work?

I like to spend time with family, and play sports such as tennis, hiking, etc.

What is your future goal?

I would like to have the company do a lot of meaningful things and be a model company. I would like to see it grow to a 100 million dollar company, and at the same time realize the dreams of those who join us by utilizing their strengths and have them enjoy life to the full.

What are your Strengths

My Strengths include achiever, strategic, intellection, belief, and significance. I am good at focusing on the goal and finding a way to achieve the results.

About Robert...

Robert began his career in consulting, particularly working with turnaround situation. He has nearly 30 years of experience in finance, accounting, operations, manufacturing, distribution, consulting and advisory.

Since then my experience extends to corporate finance, operations management and acting CFO for small to mid- sized companies, such as dealing with aerospace giants such as Boeing and Airbus along with building business relationships with technology giants such as Google and Microsoft. Robert joined Two Miles in 2017.

What is your favorite quote?

“All scripture is God breathed..." - 2 Tim 3:16 and “…he shall strike your head and you shall strike his heel.” – Gen 3:15

Why are you working at Two Miles?

I get to serve people utilizing my God given experience and skillset for kingdom purpose.

What do you like to do outside of work?

I like to spend time with family and play sports such as playing golf.

What is your future goal?

I would like to help Two Miles grow to a $100M international firm and help the lives of people both internally and externally.

What are your Strengths?

Not many but I am analytical, strategic and would like to be more empathetic.

About Masayuki...

During the department store underground boom at that time, he worked as a salesman who made a large line at the storefront. Named “Devil for Sale” and “Genius of Sales” by major department store buyers. After that, he became interested in “aggressive corporate management” from “selling”, and in 2004 joined Two Miles as a trainee. Since then, he has provided accounting and tax services mainly for small businesses.

In 2012, he moved to Hawaii to realize his slow life with his dog (a twin miniature dachshund). In September of the same year, he established the Two Miles Hawaii office. Use your head at your favorite time, wherever you want, earn so much, spend your time with your family, and bring vitality to many people.

What is your favorite quote?

Luck is what carries himself.

Why are you working at Two Miles?

Because Mr. Isogawa is the leader.

What is your future goal?

I want to move around and deliver vitality

What is your strength?

That have experienced a lot of failure

As an activity, I preside over a private school "thinking power" to increase sales (click on the image below)

About Two Miles

We are committed to offer a variety of solutions with a reasonable price. We focus on your business goals and to assist your success with passion. Our desire is to become your partners in reaching you business and personal goals.
